Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 19th overall pick, by Ashburn in 1977...
Injured on 7/18/1978 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 4/29/1979 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 8/10/1979 with a Bone Chips Elbow, out for 5 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/26/1980, off Peter Elser (SYR)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/13/1982, off Tom King (CC)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Second Base in 1983...
Drove in 7 runs against Lynchburg on 10/2/1985...
Won World Championship with Ashburn in 1987...
Traded from Ashburn to Gashouse on 2/6/1990 (Going to GHG: 2B A. Tweed. Going to Ash: 3B A. Palacios, P R. Velez)...
Signed as a free agent by Malibu on 3/1/1991 to a minor league contract.
Signed as a free agent by Pontiac on 2/18/1992 to a 3-year deal worth $449,400 per year...
